title: Ticket #5852: Eliminate need to set <SUBSYS>_ARGS.
description:
We shouldn't have to pass anything on the command-line of a "cloned" daemon (e.g., a second negotiator), because we don't have to for the original; making this true should make adding a cloned daemon much easier. This may entail adding <DAEMON_NAME>.PORT and <DAEMON_NAME>.SOCKET_NAME to the things DaemonCore and/or the master pay attention to, among other things.

To the extent that DaemonCore will pay attention to <DAEMON_NAME>.<parameter>, it's potentially exceedingly confusing if the master does not, as the master will claim one thing about the networking it prepared for the daemon, and which the daemon inherits; and the daemon itself will believe something else (and/or make it come true).

On the other hand, one could also argue that <DAEMON_NAME>_PORT (or <DAEMON_NAME>_<paramter-read-by-the-master> is both more in-line with the existing names and makes more sense, because telling the master to do should be a configuration parameter for the master, not some random DAEMON_NAME.
